intro: Ebenus stellata, commonly known as the starless scabious, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pale blue or pink flowers arranged in clusters. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley. Ebenus stellata is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
